Paper.Title: Syntactic parser combination for improved dependency analysis

Section.Paragraph: The goal of this article is to present our work about a combination of several syntactic parsers to produce a more robust parser. We have built a platform which allows us to compare syntactic parsers for a given language by splitting their results in elementary pieces, normalizing them, and comparing them with reference results. The same platform is used to combine several parsers to produce a dependency parser that has larger coverage and is more robust than its component parsers.
In the future, it should be possible to "compile" the knowledge extracted from several analyzers into an autonomous dependency parser.
